posts.post_content:
[Orcish Lumberjack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orcish Lumberjack) has sweet fantasies about this card when it goes to bed after the first turn.   
  
This card is one of the reasons why a good legacy land destruction deck is capable of blowing up one land a turn between turns 2-5 and up to two lands a turn after that, along with the lumberjack, [Exploration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exploration), [Deus of Calamity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deus of Calamity), [Frenzied Tilling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frenzied Tilling), [Raze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raze) and [Font of Mythos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Font of Mythos). If you see an Island, sideboard in [Wreak Havoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wreak Havoc).
posts.html:
Orcish Lumberjack has sweet fantasies about this card when it goes to bed after the first turn.

This card is one of the reasons why a good legacy land destruction deck is capable of blowing up one land a turn between turns 2-5 and up to two lands a turn after that, along with the lumberjack, Exploration, Deus of Calamity, Frenzied Tilling, Raze and Font of Mythos. If you see an Island, sideboard in Wreak Havoc.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: BegleOne (6/5/2011 12:06:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This + early ramp +[drain the well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=drain the well) and [acidic slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=acidic slime) for green land destruction deck? Then finish with [Kamahl, Fist of Krosa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Fist of Krosa) or [Spike Tiller](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spike Tiller). You kill their lands, and then your lands kill them.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
When I see cards like this, it kinda makes me feel sad about what red gets. They just get the dull old regular land destruction spells... My ally color needs a little love in the LD department ;)  
  
I wouldn't mind them bumping LD to cc4 to slow it down as long as the spells add extra effects like the one here.

Rating:

posts.post_content: At *common* this is pretty ridiculous, in particular because not only can you slow down an opponent by destroying their mana source, but also you can use the fetching ability to pull out non-basic land cards, such as [Temple Garden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Temple Garden) or [Overgrown Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overgrown Tomb)...or [Stomping Ground](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stomping Ground) if you plan on making a land destruction deck.
posts.html:
